title: Calories in Rice Paper
meta_description: Discover calories in rice paper per sheet, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for spring roll wrappers.
assumptions: Standard 22cm diameter spring roll wrapper, dry/uncooked, approx. 8g per sheet; made from rice flour and water.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, thickness, and preparation method (e.g., soaked or fried). Check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: One sheet of rice paper contains about 25 kcal, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in oil (adds ~10g oil per sheet)

faqs.q: How many calories in one rice paper sheet?
faqs.a: About 25 kcal per standard 8g dry sheet.

faqs.q: Are rice paper wrappers low carb?
faqs.a: No, mostly carbs at ~6g per sheet, but low in fat and protein.
Approximately 320 kcal per 100g dry rice paper.

faqs.q: Does soaking rice paper add calories?
faqs.a: No, soaking in water doesn't add calories, but frying does.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in rice paper besides calories?
faqs.a: Mainly carbs (77g/100g), minimal protein (4g/100g), and very low fat/sodium.
